section.title: Part A: Core Values
section.subtitle: WHAT DRIVES YOU? - Discover your motivational compass
section.description: Answer honestly based on what truly matters to you—not what others expect.

domains.name: Altruism
domains.description: Service & Social Impact - Driven by helping others

domains.name: Economic
domains.description: Wealth & Security - Driven by financial gain and rewards

domains.name: Autonomy
domains.description: Independence - Driven by freedom and self-direction

domains.name: Power
domains.description: Authority & Influence - Driven by leadership and control

domains.name: Tradition
domains.description: Structure & Stability - Driven by rules and clear hierarchies

domains.name: Innovation
domains.description: Learning & Creativity - Driven by problem-solving and variety

questions.text: I feel happiest when my work helps other people.
Money and security are very important in my decisions.
I like choosing my own way to do tasks.
I like roles where I can lead and influence others.
Clear rules help me work better.
I enjoy trying new ideas and new methods.
I prefer helping quietly instead of getting attention.
I would be okay with a job even if it doesn't pay much.
I dislike asking permission for small things.
I like taking charge when a group is confused.
I respect traditions and the way things have been done for a long time.
I get bored with the same tasks again and again.
I will give time and effort to support a cause I believe in.
I feel stressed if my future income is not clear.
I work best when I can choose my schedule and methods.
Having power is useful because it lets me change outcomes.
I like environments where expectations are clear.
I like learning new tools and skills.
I often think about what my community needs.
I try to make smart and careful money decisions.
I would rather make my own path than follow a standard path.
Status and recognition matter to me.
I feel comfortable when there is a clear boss and clear levels.
I enjoy solving difficult problems.
I would choose meaningful work over being famous.
I want a career that can help me build wealth.
Too much supervision frustrates me.
I do not want to lead other people.
I like using proven systems instead of changing everything.
I like variety in what I learn and do.
I want to use my strengths to support people who need help.
High salary is a big factor when I choose a major or career.
I like working alone for long periods.
I enjoy persuading people and shaping decisions.
I dislike situations where rules keep changing.
I enjoy creative work where style and originality matter.
Helping others should not cost me time or effort.
I can accept financial risk if the work feels meaningful.
I would struggle if I had to follow detailed instructions every day.
I want people to look to me for direction.
I like familiar routines more than constant change.
I often think of many ideas quickly.
I'm interested in roles where I can support, guide, or protect others.
I would be unhappy if my job did not improve my lifestyle.
I would accept uncertainty to keep my freedom.
I avoid competition and do not like comparing myself to others.
I feel safer when decisions follow rules, not personal opinions.
I like learning because it changes how I see the world.
I want my success to help others too.
Long-term security is more important than short-term excitement.
I prefer being responsible for my own results.
I enjoy being a public representative for a group.
I respect authority when it is fair and consistent.
I like building better systems and improving how things work.
I feel proud when I make someone's life easier.
Being able to afford the life I want is very important to me.
I prefer choosing my own goals instead of being given goals.
I like jobs where my decisions affect many people.
I question traditions when they no longer make sense.
I prefer stable routines over new ideas.
